intro: Zornia gibbosa, commonly known as the rough zornia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its pods are elongated and contain several seeds. Zornia gibbosa plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals.
